title.narrative: Support to vulnerable farmers and breeders (including IDPs and returnees) to improve their food and nutrition security

description.narrative: The current proposal is composed of two main interventions:1) Targeted provision of good quality improved wheat seeds to 20,000 most vulnerable farmers households in Al-Hasakeh, Ar-Raqqua, Deir-Ez-Zor and Aleppo (about 20% of the total vulnerable population) and 2) Animal health treatment for sheep and cattle against parasites in the governorates of Rural Damascus (East Ghota), Deir-Ez-Zor and Ar-Raqqua. The animal treatment campaign will target 33,000 vulnerable breeders households from the most vulnerable among those who receive the animal treatment. The project will target in total 53,000 farmers and breeders households (318,000 people) of the most vulnerable farmers and breeders who do not have capacity to access good quality inputs, through its Food Security and Agriculture engagement.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Support to vulnerable farmers and breeders (including IDPs and returnees) to improve their food and nutrition security

receiver-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS SYRIAN ARAB REPUBLIC (SYRIA) UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES DISPLACEMENT 2020

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Animal production and health for 30,000 vulnerable breeders households is improved
N. animals treated against endo and ecto parasites
N. veterinarians with improved knowledge through refresher training on specific topics
Wheat production of 20,000 vulnerable farmers households in wheat major production areas (Al-Hasakeh, Ar-Raqqua, deir-Ez-Zor and Aleppo) is increased
N. beneficiaries receive improved seeds (200 kg each)
N. farmers improved knowledge on good production practices
